abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

inlineContent.text: The tvOS 14 SDK provides support to develop tvOS apps for Apple TV devices running tvOS 14. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 12, available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 12, see
Picture in Picture on tvOS allows for simultaneous video playback and the ability to swap between full-screen content and Picture in Picture. Use
for adopting Picture in Picture in a standard player or AVKit framework’s
class for your custom player. (54986706)

With multiuser support for gaming, your game can switch dynamically between users, and use both Game Center and iCloud to keep track of multiple players’ individual game levels, leaderboards, and invitations. The User Management entitlement has been expanded to include
. This new value grants access to a separate set of data for your app for each user from Game Center, iCloud, and local storage. (56116380)
New APIs are available for using
from Swift as part of the framework

, can be instantiated using a subsystem and category, and provides methods for logging at different levels (
The
APIs support specifying most formatting and privacy options supported by legacy
APIs.
The new APIs provide significant performance improvements over the legacy APIs.
You can now pass Swift string interpolation to the
function.
Note:
The new APIs can’t be back deployed; however, the existing
API remains available for back deployment. (22539144)

to provide more specific details about the progress of the task. (63580200)

abstract.text: A controller that responds to user-initiated Picture in Picture playback of video in a floating, resizable window.
A view controller that displays content from a player and presents a native user interface to control playback.
The content and behavior of the app.
A representation of a color that adapts to a given context.
A control used to select a color from the system color picker UI.
A view that displays an image.
A `PickerStyle` where each option is displayed inline with other views in the current container.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column, optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
A control for selecting from a set of mutually exclusive values.
A view that shows the progress toward completion of a task.
A type-erased label that describes the current value of a progress view.
A view that describes the task represented by the progress view.
A result builder for composing a collection of scenes into a single composite scene.
A view that provides programmatic scrolling, by working with a proxy to scroll to known child views.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
A model that represents a group of `ToolbarItem`s which can be placed in the toolbar or navigation bar.
A custom parameter attribute that constructs views from closures.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
An abstract class that declares an interface for objects that create, interpret, and validate the textual representation of values.
An object for writing interpolated string messages to the unified logging system.
Capture telemetry from your app for debugging and performance analysis using the unified logging system.
Sends a default-level message to the logging system.
The Quartz color that corresponds to the color object.
